    Class: HMAX

    Defined in: src/hmax.iced

    Instance Method Summary

    • - (void) constructor(key, klasses = [SHA512, SHA3], opts = {}) Constructor Initializes a newly created HMAX.
    • - (void) XOR_compose(x) Combine hashes through XOR.
    • - (void) get_output_size() get the output blocksize
    • - (void) reset() Resets this HMAC to its initial state.
    • - (HMAC) update(wa) Updates this HMAC with a message.
    • - (WordArray) finalize(wa) Finalizes the HMAC computation.
    • - (void) scrub()

    Constructor Details

    - (void) constructor(key, klasses = [SHA512, SHA3], opts = {})

    Initializes a newly created HMAX.

    HMAX is our own invention, and it works as follows:

    HMAX(key,m) -> 1. Derive ikey and okey from key as in HMAC 2. Compute inner = (okey || H1(ikey || m) || H2(ikey || m)) 3. Output H1(1 || inner) XOR H2(2 || inner)

    Properties: 1. If (H2 = (x) -> null), then HMAX = HMAC.

    Examples:

    
  hmacHasher = new HMAX(key)

    Parameters:

    • key (WordArray) — The secret key.
    • klasses (Classes) — The hash algorithm classes to user

    Instance Method Details

    - (void) XOR_compose(x)

    Combine hashes through XOR. By default, we chain the hashes together, but

    - (void) get_output_size()

    get the output blocksize

    - (void) reset()

    Resets this HMAC to its initial state.

    - (HMAC) update(wa)

    Updates this HMAC with a message.

    Examples:

      hmacHasher.update(wordArray);

    Parameters:

    • messageUpdate (WordArray) — The message to append.

    Returns:

    • (HMAC) — This HMAC instance.

    - (WordArray) finalize(wa)

    Finalizes the HMAC computation. Note that the finalize operation is effectively a destructive, read-once operation.

    Examples:

    
  hmac = hmacHasher.finalize()
  hmac = hmacHasher.finalize(wordArray)

    Parameters:

    • messageUpdate (WordArray) — (Optional) A final message update.

    Returns:

    • (WordArray) — The HMAC.

    - (void) scrub()
